isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4100, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500, 8600 Models Built After 05/19/2003 - FANS AND ENGINE ACCESSORIES - SNOW VALVE (ENGINE INTAKE) - EXTENDED DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: EXTENDED DESCRIPTION
svcproc.para: The snow valve switch (1901) receives battery voltage from fuse F34 on terminal 2B.
The switch receives ground from ground buss bar (1002) on terminal 5B.

When the switch is OFF, battery voltage is applied to terminal C of the snow valve module and the snow valve motor. The switch also applies ground to terminal A, to D and the other side of the motor. This will spin the drum inside the air cleaner to open the valve until it opens a reed switch to open the circuit.

When the switch is ON, battery voltage is applied through the warning light to terminal A of the snow valve module and the snow valve motor. The switch also applies ground to terminal E and the other side of the motor. This will spin the drum inside the air cleaner to close the valve until it opens a reed switch to open the circuit.
